intro: Ceratostema miniatum, commonly known as the miniature horned bellflower, is a small, flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in partial shade to full sun. Its unique, horn-like structures on the stems and leaves give it its common name. Ceratostema miniatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
